intro: Spermacoce erythrosepala, commonly known as red-sepaled spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red calyces that persist even after the petals fall, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Spermacoce erythrosepala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
